alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 11:14PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MITCHELL... NORTHEASTERN ROOKS...JEWELL...SMITH AND NORTHEASTERN OSBORNE COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1114 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Inavale to Bellaire to near Gaylord. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lebanon and Harlan around 1120 PM CDT. Portis and Esbon around 1125 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Burr Oak, Downs, Ionia, Mankato and Cawker City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central Kansas.
